title: Parents so drunk they couldn't look after children arrested on family holiday after being found unconscious in caravan
text:
News Parents so drunk they couldn't look after children arrested on family holiday after being found unconscious in caravan Police found the parents in a drunken stupor at a North Wales caravan park after their toddler daughter contacted her granddad and told him she was scared Share The couple were arrested at Presthaven Sands Caravan Park (Photo: Daily Post Wales) Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
A couple got so drunk on a family holiday they could not look after their children - and were arrested after being unconscious in their caravan. 
Police found the Liverpool parents in a drunken stupor at a North Wales holiday park after their toddler daughter contacted her granddad and told him she was scared. 
The mum, 34, had earlier been seen staggering about an arcade on the last night of their holiday at Presthaven Sands Caravan Park in Gronant and had to be helped back to her accommodation by staff. 
She was handed over to the charge of her 37-year-old husband, but he then started binge-drinking himself after she went to sleep. The family were on holiday at Presthaven Sands Caravan Park (Photo: Daily Post Wales) 
Prosecutor Justin Espie told Flintshire Magistratesâ€™ Court in Mold that the grandfather later called the park's security because he was concerned for his granddaughter. 
She had contacted him to say her mother was drunk, and that she was scared and wanted to go home. Read More 'Drunk' man aims rockets into fireworks shop sparking huge blaze as workers run for their lives 
When they attended they found the caravan in a state which looked as if it had been ransacked. 
The couple were asleep in different bedrooms and the staff had difficulty waking them, the Liverpool Echo reported . Presthaven Sands Caravan Park (Photo: Daily Post Wales) 
There was a lighter and medication on the floor which their two young children could have easily had access to. 
The mother did not respond initially but when she staggered into the living room her speech was slurred and she blamed her daughter for the mess. 
Mr Espie said that the father was in another bedroom and police had difficulty waking him up. 
They shone a torch in his face and when he woke up appeared shocked that the police were there. The girl's concerned grandfather contacted security at the North Wales holiday park (Photo: Daily Post Wales) 
He was said to have argued with his partner after she returned - and after she went to bed he drank too. 
It was stressed that the children had not come to any harm. 
Magistrates heard social services were now involved with the family and that the children were temporarily living with a relative. Read More Britain's 'sweariest man' jailed after his latest tirade - about the Queen 
The couple, who cannot be named to protect their children's anonymity, had split and they had regular access although it was planned that the children be returned to the mother. 
The father, who was already known to the probation service, was placed on a 12-month community order with 80 hours unpaid work and rehabilitation. 
His wife was bailed pending a pre-sentence report. Like us on Facebook
